Important to who? What area? Science? Geopolitics? Our survival? IMO, the most important things history provides are lessons for survival and evolution. Which groups are trustworthy, peaceful, cooperative, war mongering, deceptive, etc How did different groups solve major challenges? How did different groups amass their power. How did they fall? Which systems of governance are effective and why? What is common among the most successful groups of people? Can we copy that? What is common among the most unsuccessful groups of people? Can we avoid that? How can a nation guarantee its safety. eg mutually assured destruction What are the main themes/traits of human kind. eg stupidity, greed, selfishness, hubris, laziness, compassion, etc. For example, one useful thing I learned is that all geopolitical power comes from economic power. It drives science, politics, military, “soft power”, attracts allies, attracts brains, naturally pacifies most outside groups who want to be on your good side, etc.
